recipe_name: Grilled goats' cheese crostini with honey and thyme served on a herb salad
author: James Tanner
method: Cut out two 5cm/2in circles of bread using a pastry cutter. Drizzle each with a little olive oil. Heat a griddle pan and griddle for two minutes on each side, or until golden.  Preheat the grill to medium. Place the griddled bread onto a baking sheet, top with the goats' cheese, honey and thyme leaves and place under the grill for 3-4 minutes. Place the herbs into a large bowl, add a splash of olive oil and the balsamic vinegar and mix to coat the leaves. To serve, place a pile of herb salad onto a serving plate and top with the goats' cheese crostini.
